channel.title: Back with more math
channel.description:
Okay so my teacher just slammed us with a homework assignment, and she hasn't taught us half the things on here.
So my question is this.
How do I do equations like: 3 + 6x = 4x + 9?
I need to solve for x.

item.description:

item.title: Back with more math
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:2, topic:360132”]collect like terms:
9 - 3 = 6x - 4x
simplify:
6 = 2x
solve:
x = 6 / 2
x = 3

You’re such a fucking retard.[/quote]
Right back at you.

Read full topic

item.title: Back with more math
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Just enter them into www.wolframalpha.com and it’ll solve nicely.

wolframalpha.com

Wolfram|Alpha: Making the world’s knowledge computable

Wolfram|Alpha brings expert-level knowledge and capabilities to the broadest possible range of people—spanning all professions and education levels.


As you can see each half of the equations is plotted on a graph and where the two equations meet is what X must be.

Read full topic

item.title: Back with more math
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

3 + 6x = 4x + 9
3 - 9 = 4x - 6x
-6 = -2x
6 = 2x
3 = x

Long answer is long.

Read full topic

item.title: Back with more math
item.dc:creator: @Original_Daniel Original Daniel
item.description:
@Original_Daniel wrote:

What you do to 1 side, you do to the other. Use this to simplify. It’s fairly straight forward.

Take away 3, and 4x from both sides leaving

2x=6

Divide both sides by 2

x=3

Read full topic
